daily.summary: Mixed precipitation throughout the week, with temperatures rising to 5°C on Tuesday.

data.summary: Light rain starting in the evening.
Light snow (under 1 cm.) starting in the evening.
Light snow (under 1 cm.) in the morning and overnight.

alerts.title: Coastal Flood Advisory for Hudson, NJ
alerts.description:
...MINOR TO LOCALLY MODERATE COASTAL IMPACTS TONIGHT...
...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS
AFTERNOON TO MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT...
* LOCATIONS...COASTAL LOCATIONS ADJACENT TO NEWARK BAY...THE
ARTHUR KILL...AND TIDALLY AFFECTED PORTIONS OF THE HACKENSACK
AND PASSAIC RIVERS.
* TIMING...MINOR COASTAL FLOODING WITH THIS EVENING HIGH TIDE
CYCLE.
* TIDAL DEPARTURES...2 TO 3 FEET ABOVE ASTRONOMICAL TIDES THIS
EVENING.
* COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...FLOODING OF THE MOST VULNERABLE SHORE
ROADS AND/OR PROPERTIES DUE TO HEIGHT OF STORM TIDE OR WAVE
SPLASHOVER. MAJORITY OF ROADS REMAIN PASSABLE. THERE IS NO
SIGNIFICANT THREAT TO LIFE AND ANY IMPACT ON PROPERTY IS
MINIMAL.
...NY HARBOR WATER LEVELS FOR THIS EVENING...
COASTAL............TIME OF......FORECAST TOTAL.....FLOOD.....
LOCATION...........HIGH TIDE.....WATER LEVEL.......CATEGORY..
...................................(MLLW)....................
THE BATTERY NYC......759 PM.........6.9-7.4.........MINOR.....
BERGEN POINT NY......758 PM.........7.2-7.8.........MINOR.....

alerts.title: Blizzard Warning for Hudson, NJ
alerts.description:
...BLIZZARD IMPACTING MUCH OF THE AREA INTO TONIGHT...
...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY...
* LOCATIONS...NEW YORK CITY AND SOUTHERN WESTCHESTER COUNTY IN
SOUTHEAST NEW YORK...AND HUDSON...ESSEX AND UNION COUNTIES IN
NORTHEAST NEW JERSEY.
* HAZARD TYPES...WIDESPREAD BLIZZARD CONDITIONS...WITH HEAVY SNOW
AND POTENTIALLY DAMAGING WINDS CAUSING CONSIDERABLE BLOWING AND
DRIFTING SNOW AND NEAR ZERO VISIBILITIES.
* ACCUMULATIONS...SNOW ACCUMULATION OF 20 TO 25 INCHES.
* WINDS...NORTH 20 TO 30 MPH WITH GUSTS UP TO 50 MPH.
* TEMPERATURES...IN THE MID 20S.
* VISIBILITIES...ONE QUARTER MILE OR LESS AT TIMES.
* TIMING...THROUGH TONIGHT.
* IMPACTS...EXTREMELY DANGEROUS TRAVEL DUE TO HEAVY SNOWFALL AND
STRONG WINDS WITH WHITEOUT CONDITIONS LIKELY. SECONDARY AND
TERTIARY ROADS MAY BECOME IMPASSABLE. STRONG WINDS MAY DOWN
POWER LINES AND TREE LIMBS.

alerts.title: Coastal Flood Advisory for Queens, NY
alerts.description:
...MINOR TO LOCALLY MODERATE COASTAL IMPACTS TONIGHT...
...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST SUNDAY...
...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS
AFTERNOON TO MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT...
* LOCATIONS...COASTAL LOCATIONS ADJACENT TO THE SOUTH SHORE OF
QUEENS.
* TIDAL DEPARTURES...TIDES OF 2 TO 3 FEET ABOVE ASTRONOMICAL TIDES
THIS EVENING.
* TIMING...MINOR COASTAL FLOODING WITH THIS EVENING HIGH TIDE
CYCLE.
* BEACH IMPACTS...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS AND LARGE BREAKING WAVES
ON THE ATLANTIC FACING SHORE OF QUEENS MAY RESULT IN EROSION
OF DUNES AND LOCALIZED OVERWASH FOR THE BARRIER BEACHES.
* COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...FLOODING OF THE MOST VULNERABLE SHORE
ROADS AND/OR BASEMENTS DUE TO HEIGHT OF STORM TIDE OR WAVE
SPLASHOVER. MAJORITY OF ROADS REMAIN PASSABLE. THERE IS NO
SIGNIFICANT THREAT TO LIFE AND ANY IMPACT ON PROPERTY IS
MINIMAL.
...SOUTH SHORE BAYS WATER LEVELS FOR THIS EVENING...
COASTAL............TIME OF......FORECAST TOTAL.......FLOOD.....
LOCATION...........HIGH TIDE.....WATER LEVEL.........CATEGORY..
...................................(MLLW/NGVD).................
JAMAICA BAY NY........807 PM.....7.7-8.2/............MINOR.....
ROCKAWAY INLET NY.....727 PM.....7.9-8.4/............MINOR.....
